definition: (located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
to ask for trouble/to bring misfortune on oneself

sentences.english: He seemed a little bit awkward when I talked to him.
sentences.chinese: 当我与他谈话时，他似乎有点不自在。

sentences.english: As a result, you feel out of place without a beverage in your hand .
sentences.chinese: 结果是，你觉得手中没酒就很不自在。

sentences.english: He was never at his ease with Frank.
sentences.chinese: 他跟弗兰克在一起总是感到很不自在。

sentences.english: I feel like a fish out of water among those high-society people.
sentences.chinese: 和那些上流社会的人在一起，我感到很不自在。

sentences.english: A long time ago, a man unencumbered own good uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，自己一个人无牵无挂，好不自在。

sentences.english: She listens to here they spin a yarn, 1:00 doesn't feel uneasiness.
sentences.chinese: 她在这里听他们说故事，一点不觉得不自在。

sentences.english: My emotions continued to seesaw between pleasure and embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 我的心情也依然在高兴与不自在之间摇摆不定。

sentences.english: Both Jane and Elizabeth felt uncomfortable, and sympathized with each other.
sentences.chinese: 简和伊丽莎白都感到很不自在，两人同病相怜。

sentences.english: The self-help workshop was very touchy-feely, and made me fell uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 自助车间太过于情感化，使我感觉很不自在。

sentences.english: He felt very uncomfortable and looked entreaty at us.
sentences.chinese: 他感到很不自在，用恳求的目光望着我们。

sentences.english: He felt ill at ease living in a white- dominated society.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得生活在一个白人统治的社会里很不自在。

sentences.english: I feel uncomfortable if I forgot to bring the hand-set when I go outside.
sentences.chinese: 每当我忘记带手提电话，我会感到不自在。

sentences.english: The young king was uneasy on the throne.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻的国王对身居王位感到很不自在。

sentences.english: Jiang Chang Yang often and secretly looking at her and uneasinessly takes behind a look in the eyes again.
sentences.chinese: 蒋长扬不时偷偷看着她，又不自在地将眼神收回去。

sentences.english: Not that Touchstone felt at ease in his clothes either.
sentences.chinese: 同样，塔奇斯顿对自己的衣服也觉得不自在。

sentences.english: And you think she might just feel a little uncomfortable with being there.
sentences.chinese: 你觉得她可能会有点不自在。

definition: to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
